Row.Text: Adjacency: Double [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for adjacent Harbors. Standard [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for each adjacent sea resource. Minor [ICON_Culture] Culture and [ICON_Gold] Gold bonus for adjacent district tiles.
A specialty district focusing on city growth that provides bonuses to pastures and camps.

A specialty district that utilizes [ICON_RESOURCE_WINE] Wine, [ICON_RESOURCE_TOBACCO] Tobacco, [ICON_RESOURCE_INCENSE] Incense, [ICON_RESOURCE_TEA] Tea and [ICON_RESOURCE_COFFEE] Coffee. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, so long as the city doesn't have another Luxury District.
Adjacency: Double [ICON_Culture] Culture [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Science] Science for adjacent Commercial Hubs.
Aztec replacement for the Masons' Quarter. Provides additional faith to internal trade routes and when worked, and 1 Great Prophet Point per turn. Grants access to the Sacrificial Rites Project.

A specialty district that utilizes [ICON_RESOURCE_BANANAS] Bananas, [ICON_RESOURCE_COCOA] Cocoa, [ICON_RESOURCE_TRUFFLES] Truffles, [ICON_RESOURCE_CITRUS] Citrus, [ICON_RESOURCE_SUGAR] Sugar, [ICON_RESOURCE_SALT] Salt and [ICON_RESOURCE_SPICES] Spices. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, so long as the city doesn't have another Luxury District.
Adjacency: Double [ICON_Culture] Culture [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Gold] Gold for adjacent Commercial Hubs.
A specialty district focusing on city growth that provides bonuses to sea resources.
Indian replacement for the Butchers' Quarter. Bonus faith and food from cattle. Provides Great Prophet Points when worked.
Norwegian replacement for the Fishery. Provides additional culture from sea resources.
A specialty district that initially produces faith, and later, converts it to other yields as well.
French replacement for the Commercial Hub. Provides bonus culture from internal trade routes and workers in citizen slots.
A specialty district with bonuses to [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone, [ICON_RESOURCE_Marble] Marble and [ICON_RESOURCE_GYPSUM] Gypsum.
A late-game district that provides [ICON_Housing] Housing and Growth for your empire.
A specialty district focusing on city growth that provides bonuses to farms and farmed resources.
A specialty district for naval military facilities. Exercises Zone of Control and has an attack.
Adjacency:Quadruple [ICON_Production] Production for adjacent Dry Docks. Double [ICON_Production] Production for adjacent Harbors.
Egyptian replacement for the Millers' Quarter. Provides additional faith to farms and internal trade routes.

A specialty district that utilizes [ICON_RESOURCE_AMBER] Amber, [ICON_RESOURCE_DIAMONDS] Diamonds, [ICON_RESOURCE_SILVER] Silver, [ICON_RESOURCE_JADE] Jade, [ICON_RESOURCE_IVORY] Ivory and [ICON_RESOURCE_PEARLS] Pearls. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, so long as the city doesn't have another Luxury District.
Adjacency: Double [ICON_Culture] Culture [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Production] Production for adjacent Commercial Hubs.
Polish replacement for the Government Center. Grants two influence per turn instead of the usual one, and grants one diplomatic envoy immediately upon completion.
Chinese replacement for the Textiles Quarter. International trade routes from this city provide +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

A specialty district focusing on production with bonuses to [ICON_RESOURCE_COPPER] Copper, [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron, [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal, [ICON_RESOURCE_ALUMINUM] Aluminum and [ICON_RESOURCE_MERCURY] Mercury.
English replacement for the Smiths' Quarter. Has an additional gold adjacency from mines and Industrial Zones. Provides one trade route.

A specialty district that utilizes [ICON_RESOURCE_FURS] Furs, [ICON_RESOURCE_COTTON] Cotton, [ICON_RESOURCE_SILK] Silk and [ICON_RESOURCE_DYES] Dyes. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity, so long as the city doesn't have another Luxury District.
Adjacency: Double [ICON_Gold] Gold [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Science] Science for adjacent Commercial Hubs.
A specialty district focusing on production with bonuses to Forests and Lumber Mills.
A neighborhood that can be built on coastal water.
Australian unique version of the Boardwalk. Provides +2 Appeal to surrounding tiles instead of the usual 1, and provides an additional +1 Appeal to all tiles in its home city's borders.
Japanese replacement for the Naval Base, with two additional air slots. Triggers a culture bomb when completed.
